result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Alexander Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by 06-03-2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Day Reporting Center. Credit for 9 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Alexander Ford

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 20 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 9 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Day Reporting Center.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 06/03/2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pretrial Credit

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
At the request of the parties case is calendared for plea and sentencing on 06/03/2016 in Branch 22.

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in custody.  Katherine Seelow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case set for Final Pretrial. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on  June 6, 2016 at 9:00am.  State keeps offer open until June 1, 2016.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the defense motion to remove Justice Point monitoring from the conditions of bail.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Antonio Alexander Ford not in court, in custody.  Student Intern Carlos Pedraza under the supervision of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Antonio Alexander Ford not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza for Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Antonio Alexander Ford not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference, defense attorney is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Antonio Alexander Ford
Current: 3180 North 15th Street Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 01-06-2016)
Prior: 3180 North 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
